reviews.content: * Tasted it in June 2013 at a masterclass by Gordon Dundas ( Brand Ambassadeur of Bowmore, Auchentoshan and Glen Garioch) found some old notes.

N- This is a mad cousin from a shy family, as opposed to the usual soft and feather weight Auchentoshan. Olorosso rush thru with surge of dried fruits and dusting spices. Sweet custard and brown sugar from PX stream thru with ripe plums.  Rich. P- Charming, playful and full of joy. Delicious fig and cocoa follow by light ginger and sour fruit. Zesty. Lighty flat in the middle with much anticipated spices missing from the DNA. F- Medium length and medium body, smooth and gentle. A return of mouth coating chocolate. — at The Whisky Bar, Kuala Lumpur.
Very dark. Pretty oily.
reviews.nose: Very volatile and pleasant. Sweet. Sherry aromas definitely feel. Lots of dark berries. Milk chocolate. Powdered, sweet soluble cocoa.
reviews.taste: Red and dark fruit. Lots of berries. Chocolate. Milk chocolate with raspberries. Dessert chocolate. Slight bitterness. Cocoa. Oily.
reviews.finish: Dessert chocolate. Cocoa. Spices. Medium-long finish.

reviews.content: It’s almost as good as the 12 Year Old (although that is an altogether different whisky), much better than the 10 Year Old, the Classic and the Select. According to Jim Murray’s 2010 Whisky Bible, this dram is very unbalanced and thus only deserves a 74. But to me, the roughness was a bonus and came out pretty well. But that’s just me – and I do have a soft spot for my Toshans, I admit.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />
reviews.nose: The nose is sweet and warm, like most Auchentoshans in my opinion, with raisins, dades and a lot of sherry. After leaving it in the glass to settle down for a minute or two, I also sensed orange peel, toffee, a pinch of tobacco and even brown sugar. This is a very interesting nose, with lots going on at the same time. Eye opener.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />
reviews.taste: The first sip is somewhat syrupy, but in a positive sense. The soft sherry notes come out first.
reviews.finish: The finish is very, very long, fresh and fruity, but a bit dry at the death. Even a little bit bourbon-like, which surprised me somewhat. I recommend smelling your empty glass again after a minute or two. Nice! <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />

reviews.content: Aging in ex-bourbon casks, followed by further aging in an Oloroso sherry cask and finally in a sweet Pedro Ximenez sherry cask.
Already delicious for a beginner from the lowlands, oak is a bit too bitter and cheap but nice fruit tones.
reviews.nose: Dark dried fruits, Canadian sugar, bitter oranges, raisins, oak
reviews.taste: Syrup, oak, warm fruits, hazelnut, pickled mandarins, peaches etc., cinnamon, some darker honey, toffee
reviews.finish: Oak with fruits remains, a little warm, medium long

reviews.content: easy starter, nothing special but nice
- a great NAS whisky - clearly the best of the "WOOD" bottlings - very great, mild, soft and aromatic combination - PLV: for about 40 € absolutely ok, definitely worth the price
reviews.nose: directly a very great fresh, sweetish fruity aroma, toffee, caramel, fruit cocktail
reviews.taste: lighter mild start, increasingly fruity development on the palate, sweetness, toffee, mild sherry, at the end light oak, leather
reviews.finish: medium-long, very soft round finish; long finish, fruity

reviews.nose: Plums, vanilla. Thyme, sage. Some wet old wood.
reviews.taste: Sweet apples, a little peach. Light spice. Campari.

reviews.content: Drinkable but for me it is too much liquorice and coffee.
reviews.nose: Shoe polish, lemons and lots of liquorice. The distillery character is masked by the three wood.
reviews.taste: Sweet with rich toffee and maple sirup plus ginger, liquorice, coffee and white pepper. Dominated by oaky notes. Unbalanced.
reviews.finish: Medium long - sweet caramel pudding, liquorice and coffee. Unbalanced.

reviews.content: Pleasant chocolate confectionery and perfume moth, excellent balance, spicy, light, especially good aroma, but other components are not far behind.  I am a supporter of consumption of whisky in its pure form, but I can not but note the excellent compatibility of this mole with fruit, especially with green grapes.
reviews.nose: Milk chocolate, bitter chocolate, raisins and dried apricots, bourbon - perfume notes, a little carpenter workshop and furniture varnish; green grass, weak citrus notes - generally dense, balanced, interesting in development, multifaceted.
reviews.taste: Bitter chocolate, oak, pepper, creamy toffee, boiled sugar.
reviews.finish: Oak bitterness alternating with chocolate sweetness on the background of pepper and spices, medium duration, warm.

reviews.content: As warm as a real Glasgow kiss. MM
reviews.nose: Rich and complex : Armagnac and cognac,prunes and treacle cake.Stewed fruit,raisins, molasses. roasted red pepper.Complex.
reviews.taste: Complex and long -lasting,with raisins,cherries and chocolate, European oak to the fore.Sweet ad sour. Lovely.
reviews.finish: A sophisticated complex of flavour, with maple syrup,dark fruits and apples.

reviews.content: The reputation is upheld by the Three Wood Edition, a whisky with full flavors and rich aromas. A welcome addition to the series Auchentoshan whisky!
reviews.nose: Rich and sweet aromas with a fruity character and supplemented with raisins, brown sugar, caramel and toffee
reviews.taste: Soft, creamy texture with a distinct taste of sherry supported by vanilla, oak and sweet fruity ingredients such as cherries, strawberries and blueberries.
reviews.finish: A wonderful, heartwarming long finish that is fresh and fruity and sweet taste of wood has

reviews.nose: Sherry tonic, with ripe dark fruits, plum jam, tender oak, clove-like dryness and a peppery spice.
reviews.taste: Soft and supple in the body. Sherrytönig but surprisingly spicy. Licorice, again cloves, allspice. Gradually fruity, with notes of blood oranges.
reviews.finish: Medium. Juicy sherry, with fruity notes and oaky-spicy backbone.

reviews.content: It could be a little more intense and harmonious, also less sharp. However, I am also enthusiastic about the strong plum aroma. Pickled plums with cinnamon. The barrel-ripened Umeshu from Yamazaki also has a strong fruit note in this direction. That's what I really appreciate about this bottling.
reviews.nose: Very intense after pickled plums with cinnamon. The alcohol tingles the nose a bit, but still within tolerable limits. In addition, vanilla, cherries (also pickled) and delicate oak spice. With increasing warmth (lukewarm) the fruits shrink and it appears less balanced. Honey and wax are now added.
reviews.taste: Quite thin body and a little bit alcoholic. Fortunately, the pickled plum can also be found in the mouth, along with a distinct bitterness. Not bad at all, but everything could be a little more harmonious.
reviews.finish: Medium-long finish. There are the pickled plums, together with vanilla sauce.

reviews.content: Yes, what do you want to say to this bottling. For some, too artificial and in fact, like Bushmills 16yo, I feel a forced and imprinted wine-red mints that can be interesting and tasty if you catch the right day. But that's why it's not a daydram for me, but rather something "special" for the cold season. I would almost try this whisky once boiled or hot to taste.

If you are looking for fruit here, you have to pick them out of a wooden enclosure with tweezers. Like mushrooms searching in the undergrowth, there are many branches here that can cause painful scratches. In my opinion, an attempt is made here to hide sulfur-treated sherry casks behind the top of wood and sweetness. But the biting, painful feeling in the cheeks betrays its presence. Tannins are also there, but they're not what's causing the glowing mouthfeel. Pity!
reviews.nose: Heavy sweet woodiness, musty oak, a few dates and figs hiding, leather, 'Zware Shag' tobacco, the gum-tape note can't be hidden, plaster, smells a bit dusty, tire rub, sandalwood, toasted nuts
reviews.taste: Very sweet at first, then the wooden club hits, glowing sulfur notes complement the hard ride, roasted nuts are present, dark milk chocolate, possibly sloe, tannins, molasses, elderberries, caraway, lots of corners, the rubber notes keep coming to the fore
reviews.finish: Just about medium length, black tea, deep oak, mineral-salty, relatively unround and biting, musty-earthy, tanned leather, light vanilla, the mucous membranes groan after a break, woody sulphurity remains

reviews.content: It lets drink pleasantly, a good entry level.
reviews.nose: Wood, cooked fruits, caramel. Fairly standard, but soft and pleasant to breathe.
reviews.taste: Pretty sweet and woody, a little vinous. Light nutty taste.
reviews.finish: Quite short and quite woody with a slight drying of the mouth.

reviews.content: Indeed a very nice dark dram in it`s price range. I suppose this one is a splendid dram on a hot summer night with a good sigar.
Blind tasting.Guessed age: 20 years
This whisky definitely deserves attention. One of my favorites is Auchentoshan.
reviews.nose: Multifaceted, honey, with a high content of malt and wine tones. I feel dried fruits (prunes, raisins). After breathing in a snifter, aromas of vanilla, coffee, tobacco leaves and old leather appear.
reviews.taste: Sweet, full of berry, fruity and chocolate notes, with a moderate oak and spice influence.
reviews.finish: Long enough, rich. Sherry at first, with a nutty twist. Then sweet, filled with hints of prunes and milk chocolate. A little scorching at the end, with oak bitterness and hot pepper. Smoothly fading away the last in the aftertaste are vanilla and creamy echoes.

reviews.content: Three different wood types and they still couldn't drown that clear alcohol note.
Very tasty, especially the dark fruits. 78th
reviews.nose: Dark and quite heavy. Sherry, seasoning, vanilla, dark fruits, some glue (unfortunately), orange.
reviews.taste: Similar to the nose, a bit alcoholic. Intense fruity with oak.
reviews.finish: Pretty long, fruity, oak.

reviews.content: Just had a funny re-encounter with this. Back when I opened the bottle about 10 months ago, I didn't like it much & gave it something around 77 I think, then left the bottle opened & 2/3rds empty untouched for +6 months. And recently I had a dram again and it feels like it changed for the better over the last months... so now it's more like a 83/84 suddenly.Shame that all of my favorite islays just seem to turn for the worse instead of better after a few months...
A lot of wood-derived flavours and aromas
reviews.nose: Fruity. Raisins, especially dates, orange peel.
reviews.taste: Beautiful balance of dark, syrupy, fruity, maturation flavours and cedary, oily, marshmallow, characteristics from the spirit itself.
reviews.finish: Gentle, long, warming, lemon grass, spice.

reviews.content: Nice sherry, dark fruits, dried sultanas, traces of nuts, some spices, oaky, really nice balanced. Finish is all right and full of sherry. Really nice dram!
Three Wood is matured initially in bourbon casks before being finished in Oloroso or Pedro Ximenez casks TWE
Complex aromas with a fruity dominance
reviews.nose: Fruity notes of black currants, raisins, prunes and oranges, a fruit cocktail, isn't it?
reviews.taste: A creamy mouthfeel, oily and nutty and many many ripe fruits
reviews.finish: A long and smooth finish with a hint of spice.

reviews.content: Sweet and sour, nutty, orange, raisin, oak, berries, light spice. It has a dank ness to it that while brings interest, doesn’t work for me.

reviews.nose: raisins, cinnamon
reviews.taste: orange, chocolate
reviews.finish: short

reviews.nose: Nose gives the sense of light glue, spirits, dried fruits, fingernail polish, oak, flowers, toffee, dark chocolate and some sherry notes, which are quite insignificant in this case.
reviews.taste: It starts very flat, becomes a little sweet, flowery, with hints of soup, light smoke, spirit and detergent.
reviews.finish: Medium long with hints of soap, flowers, biscuits, but it´s relatively flat and not very exiting.

reviews.nose: Smell: slight flavors of fruits, slight grass, and slight apple, and also spices, lime peels, slight feels of smoke. Also a little wax and asparagus. 81
reviews.taste: Taste: sour then bolded smoke, cooked bread, and also spicy spices. citrus elements. 84
reviews.finish: Finish: biscuits, and cooked woods. 82

reviews.content: Tasted on a hiking trip on 04-06-2020.
Rather one dimensional and watery, too smooth and light for my taste
reviews.nose: Vanilla, caramel
reviews.taste: Caramel, raisins, oranges
reviews.finish: tad bitter, oaky

reviews.content: Fruity and sweet nose, with toffee and caramel in the background. A slightly rough edge was tamed with a drop of water. Quite oily, sour and bitter on the palate though, masking any underlying subtlety. Not particularly complex, and all-in-all I am left with the impression of this whisky feeling quite `closed`, even with time and water.

reviews.nose: Sweet, dark raisins and chocolate fudge that transforms in old furniture varnish
reviews.taste: Slightly sweet dark chocolate with a creamy texture
reviews.finish: Short, dry, strong bitter oak with some bitter chocolate notes

reviews.content: 10 years under bourbon wood, about 1 year oloroso, about 6 months pedro ximenez.
reviews.nose: sherry, spices (dates, marshmallow) then fruits (oranges, apricots) and vegetal notes
reviews.taste: wood then toffee, caramel, orange, candied fruits
reviews.finish: citron, epices, sherry

reviews.content: 2021-01-19: a bit thin
reviews.nose: sweet malty minimal smoke, brown sugar, orange, plum, fruit compote
reviews.taste: very light smoke, very subtle chocolate note, tingling cinnamon, a little hazelnut
reviews.finish: fruity-sweet oak on a short finish

reviews.content: The nose and the flavor was really nice and complex but the finish was a bit disappointing. Only had one dram though, have to try it again. (Rating interval 80-84)
reviews.nose: Spicy on the nose, and rubber, I am thinking a bicycle tire. A very nice scent of organic solvent, like oil paint, powdered paprika and licorice. After water more caramel notes, burnt sugar and pepperoni.
reviews.taste: Nice mouth fill, again spicy with herb salt and hints of smoked paprika, sweet notes with vanilla and brown sugar, cocoa and instant coffee. There is a vegetable note after water, I am thinking celery.
reviews.finish: The finish is relatively short and vapid. There are some weak notes of cocoa and spices in finish but it's suddenly vanished.

reviews.content: So this is such unattached sherry, certainly nothing extra. A bottle of this kind of goodness I'll let go of ...
reviews.nose: The sherry dominates, then vanilla, dark fruit and varnished wood, malt and light spice.
reviews.taste: Sherry in combination with woody bitterness, bitter chocolate and palatability - the taste is quite bitter and lacks aroma.
reviews.finish: Dozvuk is quite long and, unfortunately, a lot of woody / bitter and sharp - overall medium and not very pleasant.

reviews.nose: sherry, vanilla, oak
reviews.taste: sherry, dark chocolate, pepper, pleasant oak astringency
reviews.finish: long, viscous, warming

reviews.content: RATING: 82pts – |80 – 82 (B-) → Okay| — No major flaws, worth tasting.
After a good year, try again, thank God! Delicious.
A sweet and intense Lowland, well worth the price. Delicious.
reviews.nose: Sweet strawberry jam, ripe cherries, orange and raisins behind.
reviews.taste: Can not quite keep up with the nose. Apple, hazelnut, seasoning.
reviews.finish: A little cinnamon and coffee, short finish.

reviews.content: Would get more points from me if he had more alcohol%
reviews.nose: I'm not a fan of Auchentoshan but I think this whisky suits my taste Quite watery in the nose But clearly woody / spicy Lacquered raisins Coffee is also clearly Behind it some fruit dates / overripe cherries Some Maggi herb After some time, light marzipan With 46 or 48% I think it would be much better in the nose
reviews.taste: Mild start due to the 43% Lots of wood spice Raisins and a dark nut Coffee Fruit is readily available Cherries and plums Slightly sour/bitter at the end Finally, the wood becomes more carbonic But the 43% bother me unfortunately Unfortunately, it has little steam and flattens out
reviews.finish: Woody / Spicy Maggi herb dark chocolate

reviews.content: I can only emphasize what alectron said below. I`ve just changed my initial rate of 79 to 85, since now, after I have left the bottle open for about 8 months, it`s so much better - smoother and more balanced - than the first time I tasted it. Now the sherry and oak notes are well integrated, when I opened the bottle the sherry was too strong. Very pleasant dram now. It`s something strange: You never drink the same whisky twice. (Whisky-drinkers variation of Heraclitus` "No man ever steps into the same river twice")

reviews.nose: Dark fruits
reviews.taste: raisins  wine cream

reviews.content: n: sherry, red fruit, cherry, plumbs, oak, sourt: sweet, oaka: oak, sherry
German Youtube Review: https://youtu.be/qVrW8N9QKjU
reviews.nose: Sweet, fruity, and warm – like a plate of honey, raisins, plums, and a touch of caramel placed on a warm oak platter. The bourbon adds vanilla and citrus, the oloroso provides nuttiness and dark fruit, and the PX contributes rich sweetness. Everything remains light and smooth, typical of Auchentoshan, but with significantly more depth than the standard bottlings.
reviews.taste: Round, sweet, fruity, and creamy – like a golden thread of honey trickling over raisin, plum, white grape, and a touch of chocolate. Add to that vanilla, malt, caramel, and a gentle, dry oak spice. The three cask types blend together, but without undue force – harmonious rather than powerful.
reviews.finish: Medium-long, sweet-woody and slightly dry. Raisin skin, vanilla, caramel and a subtle hint of spice linger – like the final notes of a warm dessert wine in the evening.

reviews.nose: Immediately strong, intense fruity, in the background light cinnamon, citrus (orange), sweet molasses, some oak, malt and nut pretty close to each other
reviews.taste: Sherry is very present. Very spicy, softens later sweet sweetness, oak light, quite dry, nut is clearly noticeable. It is creamy and has a light touch of cinnamon
reviews.finish: Medium to long. Drying, there is no bitterness, sherry remains throughout, malt and oak remain longer in the mouth.

reviews.content: Nose is weak to say the least. Taste hits the palate like a nuke, lots of caramel at the start, then an overdose of tanines. Very flat whisky, not complex whatsoever. Used too many casks for maturation, tastes like inferior?¿ stuff to be honest. Tanines killed the spirit. Try to triple mature like Laphroaig did with their Triple Wood. It's way more balanced and complex, spirit seems more alive.Rated this 58/100. Don't need to taste this again, or perhaps a future version in a few years when they [Auchentoshan] learned not to add heaps of caramel.

Smell orange (peel), resin, wood. Sherry in scent and in color. Many different flavors described in 4 tastings: currants (2x), citrus (2x), chocolate, black fruit. Vanilla, later creamy on the tongue - with sharp edge. One time vague turpentine air is described. Haagse Hopjes, marmalade. Very tasty, "fall whisky".

Viewing Eyes: Copper-gold smells Nose: Unsatisfactory alcohol adhesion, caramel baking staple, brown sugar,  Taste Palate: sour and bitter, inferior black chocolate, diluted brown sugar water, high alcohol irritation Finish: bitter base, sour green orange peel, no citrus aroma Body: water, loose  Nose: 75/100  Palate: 50/100  Finish: 75/100  Body: 75/100  Overall: 60/100
Simple, straightforward, not interesting, somehow brandylike
Rich flavoured.
reviews.nose: Blackcurrant, brown sugar, orange, plum and sultanas.
reviews.taste: Fruit and syrup, hazelnut, cinnamon and lemon. Butterscotch.
reviews.finish: Fresh and fruity, butterscotch and dark chocolate.

reviews.content: Very drinkable whisky, lots of wood. I donâ€
reviews.nose: Wood and some sherry notes, easy on the nose. Not bad..
reviews.taste: Smooth taste, sweet and maybe some rubber. In the background, there are some bitter flavor.
reviews.finish: Medium long finish, with a spicy end.

reviews.content: This is no bad whisky, but there is something slightly... unsettled and unbalanced about the taste. It`s quite complex and nuanced, but I`m not entirely sure this particular combination of casks works well - there`s simply too much obtrusive bitterness coming from (I suspect) the sherry casks, which doesn`t mesh well with the floral and strong tea notes.
One of the better whiskys floral will stick for a while

Medium tears. Wood is there but it tastes a bit designed to me! Also a bit off-balance with some heat from alcohol. (Did it get more after opening the bottle?)78-80 points (after opening)76-78 points (after 3 weeks).
reviews.nose: Woody nose. Medium impact. Dark fruit and dried fruit. Hints of spice.
reviews.taste: Smooth (bit oily) soft sweet. Toffee, caramel, dried fruits. Little spice. Needs somewhat else to balance the sweetness.Some typical sherry PX notes are there.
reviews.finish: Woody finish, finishing with sweet caramel and toffee (lots of toffee). Could have more complexity and gets somewhat boring after a few sips!Medium to short finish.

reviews.content: Ex-bourbon and finish in Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks
reviews.nose: Dark chocolate, oranges, raisins, cherries, dates and other dark fruits
reviews.taste: sweet, fruity and spicy, dark fruits such as plums, syrup, hazelnuts, cinnamon, citrus fruits
reviews.finish: fruity, medium long.

reviews.nose: Sherry on the nose, cocoa, even slightly pure in coffee, candied walnut, very flattering, rounded off by pleasant notes of wood (seasoned wood)
reviews.taste: On the palate, wood and sherry are predominant, relatively dry, the mildness of a triple distilled seems only slightly more easily.
reviews.finish: In the finish purely come the more sweet cocoa notes, but the wood and sherry always remain present.  The finish is quite long, warm, and ends in the wood.

reviews.content: Normal, smooth NASik. Good nose, average taste and decent aftertaste.
reviews.nose: Saucy, bright, dried orange peel, smoked orange, piece of wood, cucumber pickle.
reviews.taste: Bread theme, crust of white bread, crackers, orange again, bitterness and astringency of a piece of wood.
reviews.finish: Unexpectedly complex, repeats one to one taste.

reviews.content: A damn good Bang-for-your-Buck Single Malt with a lot of Sherry cask influence.Due to Auchentoshan's light Distillery character the cask shines through even more.
reviews.nose: sweet,syrupy,PX sherry,vanilla,raisins,caramel,herbal,grassy,cinnamon
reviews.taste: light acidity,berries,raisins,caramel,spicy,chocolate,leather,oak tannins
reviews.finish: medium-to-full Bodied.medium-to-strong Alcohol Heatmedium-to-long lasting Finish

reviews.content: BLIND PROVENProduct of chemistry.Aroma : off-balancedVarnish, un-refined oil, raisins, plums, slightly molded cheese, hint of orangePalate : sharper than should be for this level of flavour intensityArrival : bourbon-like caramel, nothing moreDevelopment : Char, Plums and very distant dried fruits, burnt branches and earth, chemical varnish note

Aroma: wood, sweetness, fruits, strawberries, sherry, slivovitz, oak, strong, roasted aromas, chocolates, chocolate, liquorice;  Taste: pleasant sweet, soft, chocolate, bitter choco;  Finish: longer with sherry, chocolate and berries, warming;  Conclusion: wood and fruits in a strong mixture, yummy! The three types of keg have done a great job. It has emerged a tasty, complex whisky.
Very good balanceTasted at www.romfestival.dk 2012-11-04
reviews.nose: Clean ethanol, light spicy, sawdust from hard oily wood
reviews.taste: Warm honey, nuts, dried fruits
reviews.finish: Faint sulphur, light salty, nice and round

reviews.content: Ball purely for the nose. There is nothing to drink here
good value  really good whisky
reviews.nose: soft and sweet
reviews.taste: oily texture, deep sweet-sweet flavors with a bit of citrus in the background
reviews.finish: long and oily

reviews.content: Woody and flowery on the nose, woody and smooth taste, medium long finish. A good everyday dram.
The whisky is very accessible, yet powerful and although soft, yet complex.  Personally, I think it is a very nice whisky, which would do well even after a sweet dessert as a digestive.
Blindtasting, rather too easy nosing for its rather dark color, vmtl. Red wine finish, weak finish, not more than 43%, mediocre
reviews.nose: Dark fruits, apple, chewing gum, light red wine, no smoke
reviews.taste: Powerful fruits, complex, sweet
reviews.finish: Very short, soft, little wood

reviews.content: Place: Hulshout Water Supply
reviews.nose: apricot, dades, some "thickness", dried fruit
reviews.taste: cashew, farmy hints, ripe fruit
reviews.finish: rather short, grassy, oaky tannine

reviews.content: Fragrance-86, Taste-90, Finish-87. Average: 88 tops!
Points: Fragrance-86, taste-90, finish-87.  Average: 88 topper!
reviews.nose: Delicious fresh and fruity, floral scent.
reviews.taste: Sweet, the fruity also comes up again.
reviews.finish: Fresh and fruity and a bit of woody taste, and quite long.

reviews.nose: Zitronenschale, schwarze Johannisbeere, Holz,
reviews.taste: Rote Früchte, Holz, Schokolade, Kakao, Süße, weicher Alkohol
reviews.finish: Kurz und bündig

reviews.content: A lot of flavers
Unspectacular. Very woody.
Not too complicated. Refined base allows you to feel the influence of barrels. Whisky leaves a good impression. Well suited for a drink.
reviews.nose: New glossy magazine, sherry, dark chocolate, ripe red apples, oak. Saturated and dense.
reviews.taste: Dark chocolate, oak, hazelnuts.
reviews.finish: Characteristic pleasant bitterness, red apple, chocolate. Long.

reviews.content: Triple distilled Lowlander, who can score with massive oak charging. Nose and taste form nice counterpoints. A little more sweetness on the finish would have been pleasant. For that you get full oak power.
reviews.nose: Fresh sherry in combination with slightly oak spice, vanilla ice cream with raspberries, with some time comes caramel sweetness, wonderfully round and sweet, nothing of the alcohol, syrupy berry wine, cinnamon, cloves
reviews.taste: Significantly spicy and stronger on the tongue than expected, accompanied by fruity sherry, rhubarb compote, raspberry again, all accompanied by a persistent oak flavor
reviews.finish: Consistent oak-red, not too strong but persistent, slightly nutty, dry fruit component, which is literally crushed by wood, then it is always dry in the mouth

reviews.content: Delicious whisky in the price range! Recommended!

I've heard a lot of good things about the old bottling, but had to settle for one from 11.2020 instead. I've heard this was aged for 12 years in ex-bourbon, plus 2 years in 2 different sherry casks. However, as with any NAS whisky, it's virtually impossible to verify the real age.
reviews.nose: I love a good sherried whisky, but this isn't what I was expecting at all. This is like cognac, pure cognac. Seemingly something close to XO class. Raisins, berries, a touch of vanilla and spice, some tobacco and leather. Quite heavy on oak, but not overpowering. But where's the malt? I can't find any distinct whisky notes in this, no matter how hard I try. It's still a very nice nose, but it's not exactly a whisky nose per se.
reviews.taste: A bit less cognac, more like a good brandy, but still not quite the sherried whisky I was looking for. I guess this is what happens when you run a triple distilled malt without much character of its own through heavily seasoned sherry casks. The sherry has taken over the palate completely. At the same time, it's not exactly what I would call a sherry bomb either. A sherry bomb whisky is a fine fusion of malt and brandy notes, but I'm simply not getting the malt here. It's also bit thinner than I expected. Watering down to 43 ABV and chill filtering this release was not the best idea.
reviews.finish: Medium, sweet and dry. Moderately heavy on oak. I'm also getting some leather, tobacco and black tea notes, plus a light touch of pepper. It's a classic sherried finish, minus the malt, which is nowhere to be found.Final thoughts: I really find it hard to recommend this release, although I don't dislike it myself. It's certainly unusual and even somewhat pleasant, but it simply doesn't smell or taste like whisky at all. That would be more forgivable if only this was a proper sherry bomb, with a thicker body and more actual distillery character. I would love to try an unfiltered release at 46 ABV.

reviews.content: You need to nip this whisky a couple of times to start realizing it's actually a damn nice dram! Well worth a try.

Nose: lots and lots of raisins, dried exotic fruits, strong varnish notes with metallic overtonesPalate: dry and bitter (cocoa beans) with a smidgen of what we Scots call foostienessFinish: surprisingly long with a nice balance between sweet and sour I was anticipating a more sanitized drinking experience from a Beam Suntory but this expression ticked more boxes than I had expected.
It is a little harsh on the start. Tried with ice ball instead and it has a nice finish. Definitely my type of drink for social hangout.

I couldnt help being dissapointed by the Three Wood of Auchentoshan.Nose: Dry fruits. Thick sweet sherry.Mouthfeel: Very woody,overpowering oak over thesherry and fruits.Aftertaste: Sherry makes a come back and rich pudding with dried raisins come into the equation
Tastes oddly of coffee
